result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larodney S Raymond

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Larodney S Raymond in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Larodney S Raymond.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/28/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Expires 12/29/2022.

Defendant Larodney S Raymond appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Larodney S Raymond.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense Bail motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and SPEEDY jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defense Motion for Bail Modification

Defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Larodney S Raymond.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests bail review hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Larodney S Raymond appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Wendy Patrickus appeared by video on behalf of Attorney James Edgar Toran for Larodney S Raymond.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #21CF2795. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Wierzchowski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
On the court's own motion bail is reduced. All other conditions remain as previously set.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned due to State's Witness being out on FMLA and not receiving subpoena. Defense made a motion to dismiss due to previous adjournments. Court took motion of defense under advisement. 
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

CASE HEARING IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, appear by video. Defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Appointment Status Letter, filed.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Larodney S. Raymond - #2022007892, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Letter from defendant.  (Larodney S. Raymond - #2022007892, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court by video, defendant Larodney S Raymond not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; wasn't served. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with FLG (DOB 5.9.1994); TDS-P (DOB 11.4.2001);
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered defendant turned over for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Larodney S Raymond in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Larodney S Raymond in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Larodney S Raymond appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 3, 4, and 6.   
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
